clues.text: December 7, 1787--the date it ratified the Constitution--is on its flag
On this state's flag, adopted in 1907, a sheaf of grain, not a potato, symbolizes state agriculture
A badger & the year 1848 appear on this state's flag
Appropriately, this "Evergreen State" is the only state that has a green flag
The motto on this state's flag is translated as "If you seek a pleasant peninsula, look around you"
One of Europe's few active volcanoes, Stromboli lies in the Tyrrhenian Sea off the coast of this nation's "toe"
At 6,952 feet above sea level, Hvannadalshnukur is this North Atlantic island nation's highest point
Jabal Katrinah on this peninsula is Egypt's highest peak; in the 1970s, during occupation, it was Israel's highest point
The 1980 eruption of Mount Saint Helens in this Washington range was the first in the lower 48 states since 1917
Tbilisi, Georgia, is a major city in this range
Legend says in 1657 the ceremonial cremation of an unlucky Kimono started a fire that burned 3/4 of this city
This team that sold Babe Ruth to the Yankees is said to labor under "The curse of the Bambino"
In 1969 Governor Jimmy Carter filed a report of sighting one of these luminous objects
From the Latin for "to forewarn", it's a sensation of what will happen in the future
Mali's Dogon may have known centuries ago of this brightest star's companion star, invisible to the naked eye

Fortinbras is the Prince of Norway in this Shakespeare
tragedy
The cruel Miss Hannigan runs the Municipal Orphanage in this perennial favorite
A slob and a neat freak become rooommates in this Neil Simon comedy
This 1959 play is based on the true story of Helen Keller & the woman who taught her to communicate
Tragic plays by Sophocles include this guy "The King" & "At Colonus"
Cardio- is this body part
Kilo- means this number
Semi- and hemi- both mean this
-one can refer to a compound containing this gaseous element, atomic no. 8
Xantho- is yellow; cyano- is this color
"Bad Piggies" & "Seasons" are offshoots of this Rovio game app
The makers of the Spark-Renault SRT_01E race car, which runs on this, claim it can hit 62 mph in under 3 seconds
No. 6 of Forbes' Top 7 Tech Trends That Will Dominate 2014: this type of "printing will begin to revolutionize production"
This accessory includes voice recognition in 3 languages, so you can say "Xbox on", "Xbox demarrez" or "Xbox einschalten"
howstuffworks.com: this "colorful" way of connecting different types of tech "is wireless, inexpensive and automatic"

a place that's full of cons

clues.text: "Mine eyes have seen the glory of" this 5-word phrase
The problem with the story of this queen saying, "Let them eat cake" after being told Parisians had no bread?  It's false
Amendment 8 of the 10 collectively known as this said cruel & unusual punishment was a big no-no
Eli Whitney invented a faster version of this seed-removing machine in 1793, but simple ones were used in India in the 400s
In 1790 he became our first Secretary of State; he got a big promotion a little over a decade later
On May 17, 1792 an agreement was signed outside of 68 this street that would establish the N.Y. Stock & Exchange Board
Dog is to bark as duck is to this
A ruler is to length as this is to body temperature
Foot is to feet as datum is to this
Car is to garage as airplane is to this
Santiago is to Chile as this is to Peru
Mrs. Olinski's 6th grade Academic Bowl team is the focus of "The View from" this day of the week
"Third Grade Angels" is the prequel to this book that mentions the next school year in the title
Abracadabra!  Book one in the "Septimus Heap" series has this 5-letter title, though not spelled the usual way
Roy Eberhardt is trying to protect miniature burrowing owls in this book by Carl Hiaasen
Besides editing the Rodent's Gazette, the newspaper of New Mouse City, this mouse goes on adventures with his sister Thea
In "The Westing Game", this last testament of millionaire Sam Westing contains a puzzle; the solver gets his fortune
"The Boscombe Valley Mystery" is an 1891 short story featuring this British detective--elementary!
PC games like "The Secret of Shadow Ranch" let you solve along with this teen sleuth who made her print debut in 1930
"Beautiful Redemption" is the finale of this paranormal mystery series set in a small South Carolina town
In this series, kids who've mysteriously had their memories erased must escape from confinement in "the Glade"

rounds.text: Friedrich Froebel wanted children to grow naturally, like plants, so he named his school this
